intro: Rosa × glaucoides, commonly known as the Glaucous玫瑰, is a hybrid species within the rose family (Rosaceae). It is characterized by its distinctive bluish-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant typically produces fragrant, semi-double flowers in shades of pink and white. It is a deciduous shrub that thrives in temperate climates and well-drained soil. Rosa × glaucoides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and hardy nature.
